page.title: 09PIXIE DAY
page.content: This event takes place on the nearest Saturday to Midsummer Day. During the day and evening there are usually children's sport activities, a fayre and a disco or barn dance. The high spot is the Pixie's Revenge. A tower is erected in Board Street and camouflaged to represent a cave _ Pixies Parlour. The children dress up as pixies and act a play in which they try to silence the church bells by capturing the bellringers. When the Pixie spell is broken the bellringers are released and the Pixies return to their cave promising to return again next year to silence the bells of Ottery.
